THE OPPORTUNITY: ASSISTANT CONTROLLER, SR. ACCOUNTING MANAGER ScoreBig is looking for a results-oriented Accounting professional to captain the month-end close, run the audit, develop internal controls and help scale ScoreBig’s financial infrastructure through a period of rapid growth. We are looking for a candidate with a solid accounting foundation and wants to grow with a fast growing company. The right candidate must enjoy being “in the weeds” to reconcile accounts, make journal entries and ensure thousands of transactions from hundreds of vendors with unique rev-share and payment terms are accounted for correctly. Experience establishing processes and controls in a high transaction volume ecommerce environment is a huge plus! You’ll manage a team of 2, but need to roll up your sleeves on a daily basis. The position requires you to be hands on to develop extensive knowledge of the business and flow of the data and a deep understanding of data retrieval for reporting purposes. Specifically... Manage and perform day-to-day accounting operations including general ledger, cash, AR & AP. Prepare an accurate and timely month-end close and account reconciliations for all areas of the P&L & balance sheet with major emphasis on revenue, affiliate commissions, inventory and cost of sales. Manage weekly and monthly rev-share/COGS settlements of thousands of transactions from hundreds of inventory and affiliate vendors, all with different payments terms. Coordinate and gather information gathering from business owners in order to prepare close analysis and entries. Develop, implement, maintain and enforce internal controls and accounting/expense policies and procedures. Obtain an understanding of merchant services/credit card processing and be able to accurately reconcile/analyze a high volume of transactions. Assist the Head of Finance & Accounting and work with a cross-functional team to implement a new accounting/ERP system. Manage 2 team members and collaborate with other members of the Finance organization including FP&A. Run the annual audit in accordance with GAAP. Assist with HR functions and support external payroll and benefits providers.

Megabytes are a dime a dozen. Most .NET web applications shovel them around with little ceremony. It's boring. You can accidentally count them in milliseconds. But terabytes? I don't know, how long does it take you to count $9,162.60 in dimes? We're building a web-based platform for scientific computing that handles terabytes -- and eventually petabytes -- of data in HPC clusters, and presents interactive visualziations in a browser. It's low latency service-based programming where we try to measure in milliseconds, not seconds. Our application doesn't show the odd web page, it interacts at 60 frames per second with a user on a 32" 4k touch screen, and visualizes massive datasets. The application server is written in C#, making extensive use of the Reactive Framework. We interact with dozens of external data sources, from simple project databases to seismic databases holding those petabytes of data. We're a tight-knit team with a fascinating product with the opportunity to expand dramatically this year, and need people with the imagination and drive to make that happen.

KEY RELATIONSHIPS The Manager, Information and Communications Technology, carries primary responsibility for the leadership, management and oversight of the ICT function and support service to the company. Together with other functional heads, the position provides critical leadership support to the Operations Manager in the pursuit of the company’s strategic goals and objectives. JOB OBJECTIVE To provide strong support to the Manager, Operations in the design and implementation ICT strategies, policies and initiatives, and the management of the hardware and software resources to enable achievement of the company’s goals and objectives. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Develop the company’s ICT Plan, ensuring alignment with business strategies, enterprise innovation and transformation objectives, and technology goals. Provide strong support to business units through the accurate interpretation and analysis of business needs, justification of ICT solutions where applicable, and the design of relevant strategies to leverage ICT capability. Facilitate the development of a capable, motivated and productive ICT workforce to effectively service the company’s diverse, growing ICT needs. Build and maintain a robust ICT operating environment, ensuring network systems and infrastructure integrity, and enhancement of the ICT capability of the organization’s people resources. Design and coordinate identified ICT projects, programs and initiatives, ensuring accurate implementation, on-time completion and full attainment of promised systems gains. Manage the interface with ICT consultants, contractors and service providers, safeguarding the company’s interests and ensuring compliance with all contractual requirements, service and security standards, program budgets and risk controls. KEY FUNCTIONS Develop the organisation’s Strategic ICT Plan. Implement integrated solutions that meet current and future business needs, including process re-design. Actively monitor / seek opportunities, new methods and trends in ICT capabilities and products to support organization growth and development. Develop and implement policies for the management of ICT including security and sustainability, service standards, information management strategy and records management. Develop and execute the ICT Annual Business Plan, including management of the ICT budget. Plan and manage ICT resources and develop ICT capability of the organization’s human resources. Provide oversight of ICT consultants, contractors and service providers to ensure proper system requirements, specifications, costs and timelines. Provide reports to senior management on the progress and status of plans. Coordinate all aspects of management of the life cycle of information systems. Develop and implement the information architecture. Develop corporate Information security policy, standards and guidelines. Complete project installations and management. Design, procure, install, upgrade, operate, control and maintain ICT infrastructure components. Develop and implement Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery plans. Monitor the market to gain knowledge and understanding of currently emerging technologies. Identify new and emerging hardware and software technologies and products, and assess their relevance and potential value to the organization.

Balanced Labs is a brand new, well-funded company with teams in San Francisco and Sydney. We are creating new tools for modern accountants and the customers they serve. We are currently building several products for LendInvest - the world's largest peer-to-peer (P2P) marketplace for real estate mortgages. We are a loan originating beast as well as the lender. The work is all greenfield work (we are not refactoring the old codebase but replacing it, and there is no legacy code). There are 6 server-side developers (soon to be 5.5 as one goes half-time), 2 (soon 3) front-end, one QA, 1 technical BA, 1 offshore designer, 1 offshore sysadmin and another offshore fullstack support dev. We use the de facto industry standard tools like Grunt, Gulp, Sass, Less, AngularJS to build our apps, and design and user experience are critical. You should have 4 or or more years commercial experience as a front-end web developer. We believe that attitude is as important as experience. The ideal candidate shows energy and the will to learn and to improve themselves. If you think you've already learned everything then please stop reading now. We're looking for a good mix in Design and Coding, knowing that usually only few lucky people could master both. Our servers are on AWS, database is MySQL (soon to be Amazon RDS), we are ramping up CI with Jenkins and we use Behat and PHPSpec. We operate in an Agile environment using Scrum methodology. The successful candidate must be eligible to work in the UK without sponsorship.

The Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer implements quality initiatives related to CSD’s software and information systems development and maintenance. The goal is effective release and maintenance of high-performing quality products by promoting innovative quality assurance strategies and methodologies throughout the organization. Essential Functions Develops, implements, and maintains a plan to bring quality assurance process into compliance with industry standards and best practices Achieves QA objectives by contributing to strategic plans and revisions, preparing and completing action plans, audits, and continuous improvement plans Creates and maintains test cases and manual and automated test scripts, as well as managing the selection, deployment and use of quality tools Makes data and risk-based recommendations to business leaders on the quality levels and release readiness of software packages and patches Proactively interacts with stakeholders to ensure on-time, high-quality delivery of product releases Collaborates with stakeholders to define, develop and implement enterprise test strategies, methodologies, processes, and metrics collection Participates in walk-throughs of technical and operational features, functions and attributes of new and existing systems to promote testability Collaborates with stakeholders to create test strategies, designs, cases, scripts, schedules, training and other documents during each project cycle. Builds and maintains reusable framework for functional and regression testing Identifies and manages data needed for testing Resolves diverse problems and identifies risks using solid analytical skills where limited precedents or guidelines exist Prepares quality documentation and reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information & trends including failed processes, stability studies, and re-validations Leads QA initiatives to test all bug fixes, product upgrades, and custom development projects prior to release to targeted customers or the general user base Serves as point of contact for product quality issues; troubleshoots and solves issues for various clients and users, operating systems and networks Keeps the team appraised on test progress, issues, and quality metrics Develops and implements improvements for quality processes and tools including the implementation of automated testing techniques and tools. Conducts performance testing of highly scalable, high-performance software solutions

In the Direct Sales role you'll have the opportunity to directly impact the growth of our company. The ideal candidate will have some track record for developing and closing new business, experience working in a high-pressure and high-energy environment. Your initial responsibility will be lead qualification; you will serve as initial point of contact with prospective SMB customers and will provide product information to prospects interested in viewing a product demonstration of our SaaS platform. After an initial trial period, you will begin demonstrating our product and negotiating and closing deals with new-booked business quota. You will be required to demonstrate solution-selling skills.

Legion Logistics, LLC is a service-disabled veteran owned third-party logistics company. What does that mean in plain English? First, one of our owners was injured while serving in the US Army (and we thank him for his service). Second, we work with companies around the country helping them move their freight. We don't own the freight and we don't own the trucks - we just connect the two. Right now, the Legion is expanding rapidly (and not just because we like to have pastries at meetings) and we need good salespeople to help keep our momentum going. Our sales floor has a fun, high-energy, collaborative atmosphere. As you might have guessed, we don't take ourselves too seriously, but we do make serious money. Income potential at the Legion is unlimited, just like the free coffee. What You Can Expect From Us Training. Unlike many sales companies, we don’t expect you to come in knowing it all. We have awesome benefits. Medical, dental, and vision insurance are available to all full-time employees and the Legion pays 60% of all premiums. Every employee has a $15,000 paid life insurance policy, compliments of the Legion, with the option to purchase additional coverage. After one year, you are eligible for our profit-sharing plan, because no one wants to work forever. This job is hard, and we know everyone needs a break, so we offer 10 paid vacation days and 5 sick days per year, and paid time off for bereavement, maternity/paternity leave, and short-term disability. We are co-owned by a service-disabled veteran, and we hold our current service members and veterans in the highest regard. If you are a veteran, you are in the right place. We do not have a typical selling environment. Our brokers call themselves “cooperatively competitive” because we offer team bonuses and we hang out at internal and external events together. Unlike huge brokerages with thousands of employees, our customer base is wide open. And a largely untapped customer base means unlimited income potential. Oh, you were expecting some type of compensation? After their training is completed, Problem Solvers choose between a commission-based or base-plus-bonus compensation plan.
